result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor H Mendez Tlatoa

defendant.name: Mendez Tlatoa, Victor H
defendant.address: 2118 High Ridge Trl Apt 302, Fitchburg, WI 53711

records.addlTxt: Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14

2:39 PM Defendant Victor H Mendez Tlatoa in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Victor H Mendez Tlatoa.  Prosecuting attorney William Leroy Brown in court for the State of Wisconsin. Fayme Filipiak interpreted.The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
